data.title: The Sierpinski - Premium Handmade Djembes
data.name: The Sierpinski
data.description:
A powerful Khadi wood djembe, carved with motifs reminiscent of the Sierpinski Triangle fractal - Wacław Sierpiński's famously beautiful set of nested triangles.

One of the shorter djembes in The Drum Hut's Premium Range, this drum sits at what would generally be considered the standard adult djembe height of 24". Finished with a clean folded skin and blue/black 5mm Evolution Control rope, this djembe will stand out in any drum circle for both its sound and appearance.
data.videoCode: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/151905108?color=275fcf&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="100%" height="338" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.title: The Ramanujan - Premium Handmade Djembes
data.name: The Ramanujan
data.description:
The red Djalla wood and elegant profile and carving of this djembe provide a distinct and pleasing Islamic aesthetic. Named for the influential Indian mathematician Srinivasa Ramanujan who helped develop prime number theory, examples of prime number arithmetic can be found in the carving of this djembe - the carving has rotational symmetry of order 7, the large tringles are all 3:7 in aspect and every one contains a semi-prime number of smaller triangles.

The tall bowl shape and Djalla wood combine to make a drum with exceptionally sweet tones and very dry slaps. It's responsive at all playing volumes and if you really let rip, its tones shine through the mix with real clarity. This is one of the most pleasant djembes I've had the pleasure to both play and work on.
data.videoCode: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/149550584?color=b81f2c&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="100%" height="338" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.title: The Pascal - Premium Handmade Djembes
data.name: The Pascal
data.description: An aggressive sounding djembe with a loud, resonant voice and uncomprimising carving to match. Perfect for those who want to be both seen and heard. Named after 17th Century mathematician Blaise Pascal and the famous "Pascal's Triangle" - a triangular array that can be seen in the carving on the foot of this djembe.

data.title: The Maxwell - Premium Handmade Djembes
data.name: The Maxwell
data.description:
James Clerk Maxwell, the magnificently bearded physicist and pioneer of the study of electromagnetic waves lends this djembe his name. The delicate carving and gentle profile make this a djembe that looks beautiful and sounds sharp and clean. The slaps have an interesting mix of overtones that will be be heard through large ensembles and the tones are short, dry and percussive.

The vivid blue Evo Splice rope glows under stage lights and is one of the smoothest, supplest ropes available. This djembe has been tuned with an attractive modification of the more traditional Guinea weave. Detailed instructions of how to continue this weave will be included with the djembe. Take a look at the video below to hear him in action.
data.videoCode: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/149429117?color=3880fc&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="100%" height="338" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.title: The Pythagoras - Premium Handmade Djembes
data.name: The Pythagoras
data.description: One of my favourite colour combinations can be found on this djembe: 4mm Dyneema Purple rope and the beautiful 'Red Henna' ring wrap. Named after the most ubiquitous name in mathematics, the carving on The Pythagoras shows off the beauty in the interplay of triangles and kites. The thin skin on this djembe gives very short and dry slaps and tones, perfect for studio work and playing solo.
data.videoCode: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/180516913?color=9a38fc&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="100%" height="338" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.title: The Euclid - Premium Handmade Djembes
data.name: The Euclid
data.description: Triangles and arcs dominate the aesthetic of this djembe, meaning the only appropriate name could be Euclid; the Ancient Greek Godfather of geometry. A visually striking djembe, The Euclid will stand out from any crowd. It's yours to customise however you choose - rope colours, skin type, finishing touches - it's all up to you! Get in touch with your ideas and I'll help bring them to fruition. Typical turn around time is 2-4 weeks depending on availability of materials.
data.description2: Unfortunately this djembe has had a small issue with some pesky woodworms, but it's since been fully treated and is good as new. There were just seven flight holes in total and none of them very deep. The insects are now gone and the holes have all been filled with resin. Nonetheless, the price has been dropped to compensate for the presence of the holes.

data.title: The Escher - Premium Handmade Djembes
data.name: The Escher
data.description: Delicately, but mesmerisingly carved, this djembe is named after the artist M.C. Escher, who specialised in illusions, patterns and other mathematically inspired artwork. This lightweight djembe is yours to customise however you choose - rope colours, skin type, finishing touches - it's all up to you! Get in touch with your ideas and I'll help bring them to fruition. Typical turn around time is 2-4 weeks depending on availability of materials.
data.videoCode: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/156155336?color=fcdea7&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="100%" height="338" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.title: 13" Senegalese Djembe - Handmade Djembes
data.name: 13" Senegalese Djembe
data.description: Daring in colour, once described by one person as "disgusting" and instantly by another as "gorgeous", this is a djembe that splits opinions! It comes from Senegal and has been lovingly restored here at The Drum Hut. A crack in the foot has been repaired and the whole drum has been sanded smooth and waxed to a shine. It's tuned high and has some of the sharpest and most piercing slaps around. Made from lightweight wood but well shaped on the inside, this djembe is both easily transportable and true to the proper sound of a djembe.
data.videoCode: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/150053516?color=f531eb&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="100%" height="338" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.title: 13" Tweneboa Ghanaian Djembe - Handmade Djembes
data.name: 13" Tweneboa Ghanaian Djembe
data.description:
12.5" diameter Ghanaian djembe made from soft, lightweight Tweneboa wood - this colourful drum would be the perfect first djembe for a beginner drummer wanting to experience drum circles with a beautiful full-sized djembe. Though lacking the complex sound profile of it's Guinean and Malian cousins, this djembe will still sing out in a drum circle and will be a great drum to learn on.

This djembe has recently been skinned with black rope and a medium thickness goat skin. Photos and a demonstration video will be online soon.
data.description2: There are some small amounts of damage to the wood in the foot of this djembe. There's a chip, some damaged paintwork and a repaired hole. These are all cosmetic and will not affect the sound of the drum.

data.title: 12.5" Iroko Ivory Coast Djembe - Handmade Djembes
data.name: 12.5" Iroko Ivory Coast Djembe
data.description:
A superb sounding djembe with smooth, rich tones and surprisingly mellow, pleasant slaps. This shell was originally a Kambala djembe, probably built around 2005 and has been repurposed with a thick calf skin that gives the shell an uncommonly pleasant and smooth sound profile - none of the dry, crispness of the most expensive djembes, but a warm, rounded sound that is loved by all who've played it.

More photos and a video to come. This djembe will be available to buy soon.

data.title: 13" Ghanaian Djembe - Red Tweneboa Wood - Handmade Djembes
data.name: 13" Ghanaian Djembe - Red Tweneboa Wood
data.description: With an all new shape to the interior of the bowl, this djembe stands head and shoulders above other djembes of this type. The typical funnel-shaped carving of Ghanaian djembes, that does nothing to enhance their sound, has been replaced with the strong bowl-shaped carve of a traditional djembe. This gives the drum much more distinction between tones and slaps, reduces unpleasant overtones and makes this a much easier djembe to play. Added to all this is the benefit that comes from Ghanaian djembes being made from light woods - you'll get a good sounding, lightweight djembe that won't break your back or your bank account!
data.videoCode: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/149464673?color=ffffff&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="100%" height="338" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.title: 13" Red Tweneboa Ghanaian Djembe - Handmade Djembes
data.name: 13" Red Tweneboa Ghanaian Djembe
data.description: Another 13" diameter Ghanaian djembe made from an attractive sample of Red Tweneboa wood. Nicely carved and finished to an extremely smooth matt shine, this is a beautiful example of decorative Ghanaian djembes. Ideal for beginner djembefolas, Ghanaian djembes lack the true sound profile of a Malinke djembe, but serve as a good budget option for someone wanting to practice in drum circles with a full sized djembe that won't break the bank.

data.title: 13" Indonesian Mahogany Djembe - Handmade Djembes
data.name: 13" Indonesian Mahogany Djembe
data.description:
This lathe turned Indonesian mahogany djembe decorated with Aborigine inspired artwork is an unusual drum. The interior shape is something of a hybrid between the traditional profiles of a djembe and a bougarabou. To emphasise both characteristics, I decided to head this drum with a thick, unshaved calf skin, as would commonly be found on a bougarabou, and tune the drum to a level of tension more commonly found in djembe drums. The result is something quite pleasing to both the ear and the hands. Sharp and responsive to the touch, the slaps and tones are well defined and easy to play, but the sound is noticicably more muted and 'fat' than you'd expect from a djembe.

I'd recommend this as a perfect drum for studio recording or for an amplified percussionist in a band. However it lacks in volume when compared with other drums of similar size, so this djembe probably isn't best suited to drum circles or other unamplified situations.

data.title: 12.5" Balafon Wood Guinean Djembe - Handmade Djembes
data.name: 12.5" Balafon Wood Guinean Djembe
data.description: For a long time, this was my own personal lead djembe. It's one of the purest sounding djembes I've ever played, it's not very heavy and it's easy to play. Perfect for an intermediate or advanced player.

data.title: 11" Ghanaian Tweneboa Djembe - Handmade Djembes
data.name: 11" Ghanaian Tweneboa Djembe
data.description:
A small and pretty djembe that weighs very little. With it's sharp sound and surprisingly large bass, this makes a perfect drum for the djembefola who wants good sound at a very low price. Your back will thank you for choosing this lightweight djembe!

An unfortunate accident with a pair of scissors whilst skinning this djembe resulted in the need for two lengths of rope to be used, so the final few Verticals are roped with striped white rope.
data.videoCode: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/150055619?color=fcdea7&title=0&byline=0&portrait=0" width="100%" height="338" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.title: 13" Senegalese Djembe - Handmade Djembes
data.name: 13" Senegalese Djembe
data.description: A beautifully proportioned and excellently made Senegalese djembe, this drum will soon be among the best drums to have passed through The Drum Hut. It's made of good wood and it's well shaped, so once it has a skin, it'll be a fantastic djembe. If you'd like this djembe then get in touch quickly and you can have it with your choice of rope and skin! Don't wait too long though; I'm planning to skin this one quite soon.

data.title: 13" Cracked Ironwood Djembe - Handmade Djembes
data.name: 13" Ironwood Djembe with repaired crack
data.description: This djembe has the potential to be an excellent mid-range drum - perfect for an intermediate player looking for an upgrade to a proper djembe or a beginner who wants to invest in something a little more substantial than a Tweneboa djembe. Unfortunately though, at some point in this djembe's past, the side of the bowl has cracked, meaning I've had to have to place a few butterfly keys in to repair the crack. This djembe would normally retail for around 200 will be leaving my workshop for 160 due to the damage. Perfect for you to grab yourself a bargain!
data.description2: I'm afraid to say this djembe has been reserved, pending final skinning results. There will be plenty more like it though! Keep checking back to see what's available.

data.title: Mali003
data.name: Mali Djembe 3
